name: Laxminarayana S. Pillutla
content: Homepage of Laxminarayana Pillutla Welcome to the Homepage of Prof. Laxminarayana Pillutla at DA-IICT Contact Address: Room # 4203, Faculty Block-4 Dhirubhai Ambani-Institute of Information and Communication Technology (DA-IICT) Post Bag 4 (Near Indroda Circle) Gandhinagar - 382007 Gujarat India. E-mail: firstname_lastname "@" daiict.ac.in Phone: +91-79-30510621 About me: I am currently an Assistant Professor at DA-IICT. I obtained my PhD from the University of British Columbia, Vancouver (rated as the most liveable city in the world; it has some great beaches and has nature in its most pristine form), BC, Canada in 2009. My PhD supervisor was Prof. Vikram Krishnamurthy. My PhD dissertation title was: Resource Management in Wireless Networks. Prior to that I obtained my Masters degree from Wichita State University, Wichita, KS, USA, under the guidance of Dr. Sudharman Jayaweera (currently at University of New Mexico). My Masters thesis title was: Capacity of MIMO Systems - A Theoretical and Practical Perspective. Research areas: Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs) Cognitive Radio (CR) Vehicular Ad Hoc Networks (VANETs) Information theory Statistical Signal Processing Convex Optimization Game Theory Note: I am currently focusing on application of techniques such as Markov decision processes and game theory to the general design of wireless networks. I am also looking for a few motivated M. Tech and PhD students to work on the above mentioned research areas. Motivated B. Tech students may also contact me in case if they are interested in working on projects that involve working with embedded systems. Typical projects would involve programming of sensor nodes using TinyOS. Teaching: Autumn 2010: CT537 - Advanced Wireless Communications.course outline Winter 2010: CT517 - Statistical Estimation Theory.course outline Research Projects: Wireless Telemedicine using body area sensor networks (this project is sponsored by the Science and Engineering Research Council (SERC), Department of Science and Technology (DST) under the fast track scheme for young scientists. Total cost of the project is: Rs. 12.6 Lacs. Total duration of the project is: 3 Years).
